sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The sermon preached at the Crosse, Feb. xiiij. 1607. By W. Crashawe, Batchelour of Diuinitie, and preacher at the temple; iustified by the authour, both against papist, and Brownist, to be the truth: wherein, this point is principally followed; namely, that the religion of Rome, as now it stands established, is worse then euer it was. Crashaw, William, 1572-1626.
[16], 174 p.
By H. L[ownes] for Edmond Weauer: and are to be solde at the great North-gate of S. Paules Church, Imprinted at London : 1608.
Some print show-through; some pages stained. Reproduction of the original in the Cambridge University Library.
=======

Crashaw, William, 1572-1626.
[16], 174 p.
By H. L[ownes] for Edmond Weauer: and are to be solde at the great North-gate of S. Paules Church, Imprinted at London : 1608.
